title: Witherbloom Academy (bi-weekly narrative poetry with Ink) ep: 2
post: <center><b>Small shards of life</b></center><br> <br> Little pockets of happy <br>Floral king of life <br> No matter what they say to us <br> We know our lives are rife <br> With lust and colour <br> The moment we've glee, they’re in a dither. <br> <br> Give us a chance <br> To have love and romance <br> Yes, we are young <br> But our lungs breathe the air that you breathe <br> Our hearts feel the things that you feel. <br> We may be immature but <br> A rose by any other name would smell as sweet <br> Isn't love entitled to such? <br> <br> So I pick flowers. <br> While the hours <br> Away <br> Day to day <br> Take me away <br> To a place <br> Where I can build a bouquet <br> for the one l love. <br> <br> Let me exchange my turtle doves. <br> <br> -William <br><br><br> ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~<br><br> <b><u>(AU):</u><i> Thank you for reading this post, i really appreciate it, new entries will continue to come Sundays and Wednesdays.
